It seems like more consideration has gone into the IMDb reviews of this film than went into the source.

Here's a review without pretensions, biased, subjectively uninformed, evidence-free, and insurance-voiding: I thought 3rd Person was a surprising failure as a movie. It had great on-paper credentials: middle-aged love with or without parenthood, the messed-up lives thereof, all limited to NYC for easier controllability of narrative

predictable, campy, bad special effects. it has a TV-movie feeling to it. the voices work nicely--there is a Brick and Mortar on tour of Europe. foreshadowing. the vampires are unappealing cosmo-esque characters. traditional vampire tropes appear: biting her pillow, the fire, dribbleing blood into a goblet. the sequel is NOT as horrible as this one

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they living with and more importantly who or what is killing them? Worth watching, good plot and character build.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my mind is that the heroine itself, Snow White, is a good-natured prude without enough agency. I enjoy the story with the dwarfs (mostly Grumpy) and wish-disposal more
